reviewText: SECRETS OF THE WINE COUNTRY is a fascinating look at the history of the northern California wine industry with a special focus on the wines of Napa Valley. The California wine industry has grown from tiny beginnings to produce some of the finest wines in the world. This one hour documentary covers the early history of the Franciscan missionaries in Sonoma all the way forward through winemaker's Robert Mondavi's unique contribution and ending with the revolutionary 1976 Paris Wine Tasting where California wines were finally acknowledged as some of the best in the world.
